greetingSubtitle: Do you follow any convention when writing commit messages? In this issue, you will find articles about this subject. Of course, there are other useful topics here too.

cards.title: When and how to choose HTML for form validation
cards.description: HTML5 and the modern DOM APIs are already equipped for form validation. In this article, we’ll dive deep into all things HTML form validation.
cards.author: Joe Attardi

cards.title: The case for using Sass in 2022
cards.description: Is Sass still relevant? Let’s take another look at Sass and some of the things it is still useful for in 2022.
cards.author: Mayank

cards.title: Flex plus Grid equals CSS success
cards.description: In this article, the author shows his experiment with flex and Grid, explaining how to use these properties in practice.
cards.author: Joseph Guillory

cards.title: Write Better Commits, Build Better Projects
cards.description: High-quality Git commits are the key to a maintainable and collaborative open- or closed-source project. Learn strategies to improve and use commits to streamline your development process.
cards.author: Victoria Dye

cards.title: How to Write a Git Commit Message
cards.description: This evergreen guide on how to write Git Commit messages will help you and your team manage commits log well and make it readable.
cards.author: Cbeams

cards.title: Using barrel exports to organize React components
cards.description: In this article, you will see one of the concepts for import modules at reacts. A barrel enables us to consolidate, or roll up, exports from multiple files or modules into one single module.
cards.author: Nelson Michael

cards.title: Integrating Google Places Autocomplete API in a React App
cards.description: Google has many useful services, and Google Maps is one of them. In this article, we'll look at how to work with the Places API, which is a part of it.
cards.author: Chinedu Imoh

cards.title: How to build a notes app with React and localStorage
cards.description: It's time to remember how to use localStorage with React by creating an example app for notes. The app will have a few settings and its functionality will be to create, read and delete notes.
cards.author: Saleh Mubashar
